item.title: ITT: Health and fitness
item.dc:creator: @Stork Stork
item.description:
@Stork wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:32, topic:264922”]My bad, I meant 2x20.

I might eat more chicken, it’s tastes great too. And what about fish, is it good for healing muscles too?[/quote]
20 reps is pretty high, stick to 1-6 for building strength and 8-15 for building muscle, anything higher is really just cardio.

Chicken and fish are both fantastic. Tuna is very high in protein with almost no fat/carbs, and fatty fish have their oils which are said to contain magical powers.

Read full topic

item.title: ITT: Health and fitness
item.dc:creator: @Stork Stork
item.description:
@Stork wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:30, topic:264922”]I go to a gym now, and friday was my first day. I did an almost complete workout, to get familiar with the machines. But now I have fucking sore shoulders and elbows, and all I did was 2x40 on 3 machines involving my arms. The max weight I used was 20 kg. So how the hell can my arms be this sore?

Overall, going to a gym is great. It’s fun, not boring and healthy. I went there for one hour, and it felt like 15 minutes.[/quote]
2x40? two sets of 40 reps? Why are you doing so many reps?

As for the soreness, your muscles probably just aren’t used to such direct isolation work. Also it might be that your not eating enough, more calories (and protein) in your diet generally means you heal quicker.

Read full topic

item.title: ITT: Health and fitness
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I go to a gym now, and friday was my first day. I did an almost complete workout, to get familiar with the machines. But now I have fucking sore shoulders and elbows, and all I did was 2x40 on 3 machines involving my arms. The max weight I used was 20 kg. So how the hell can my arms be this sore?

Overall, going to a gym is great. It’s fun, not boring and healthy. I went there for one hour, and it felt like 15 minutes.

Read full topic

[quote=“jme, post:25, topic:264922”][quote author=Stork link=topic=349770.msg2689816#msg2689816 date=1235894451]

I just went for a 4 km run, it took me about 20 minutes, give or take a few.

I have a fitness test for my job on Monday. One of the tests requires a lot of shoulder strength and I am worried about it

Good work mate, I can’t run for shit. Make sure you’re rested for the test and don’t stress too much. What’s the job btw?

[/quote]

Test is tonight. I’m gonna dominate it I feel good today[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 02, 2009, 07:43:22 pm[/size][hr]FUCKING RIGHT I PASSED :D[/quote]
